Case reference: 2012000299.CaseDesc: Investigators with York Regional Police Homicide Unit are seeking assistance from the public in their investigation into the disappearance of a 45 year old woman. Cheryl Rowe was last seen by her family on December 22, 2011, just after midnight on Rathfon Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill. The investigation is still ongoing and investigators believe that Ms. Rowe may be the victim of foul play.

Tattoo: Upper Back, children's names, two wings with the words "Shane" and "Christina"

Case reference: 2005004499.CaseDesc: On August 31, 1996, the body of an unidentified woman was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist dock. Her appendix is present and she may have stretch marks on her thighs.

Teeth: She has natural teeth with one restoration in her left lower second molar.
Underwear: Plaid, Fruit of the Loom, multi-coloured, plaid panties with a white waistband, size 5
Jeans: Denim, Blue, "Hunt Club" jeans, manufactured by Sears, size 14

Case reference: 2021011416.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2021, Solange Bergeron was seen for the last time as she was drifting uncontrollably in the St. Lawrence River, near the Laviolette Park, in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance, Solange was despondent.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Straight, Long and straight

Case reference: 2022015231.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2022, Kyle Brocklebank was seen for the last time walking in the area of Thirty Road, in the town of Smithville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020010478.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1970, at approximately 3:30pm, Lois Perret was last seen by her boyfriend at her place of work in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Lois had quit her job and moved out of her apartment. During the time of her disappearance, Lois was three months pregnant and drove a 1964 black Valiant convertible.

Case reference: 2005007399.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1985, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 20 to 40 years of age, was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-190 lbs and his length was measured at 5’7”-5’10”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Brown, Curly, Shoulder, Dark moustache
Teeth: He has multiple amalgam fillings and his wisdom teeth are fully erupted.
Chain: Gold, 20 inch, 10K gold, fine weave chain necklace.
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Reddish brown leather Olympian brand shoes (extra wide).
Pants: Blue, Plaid, Grand National Trousers brand, size 36
Underwear: Blue, White, Mentug brand briefs, size large

Case reference: 2020007336.CaseDesc: On December 16, 1970, Abraham Wolfson was seen for the last time leaving a law office in Toronto, Ontario. Abraham had left with certificates worth $50,000 and had come into the city to arrange the sale of a property. Despite the offer of a reward from Abraham’s family, there has been no information pertaining to his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2006008199.CaseDesc: Harley Metherel telephoned home from Vancouver on December 24, 1980, requesting a money transfer. Money was sent to him, but he never picked it up, and he has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006180.CaseDesc: Tammy Penner has not been in contact with friends or family since 2005. Tammy did not live in one place for any significant period of time, and has traveled across Canada. Prior to her disappearance, she had been living in Chilliwack and Abbotsford in British Columbia. Tammy suffered from a drug dependency.

Case reference: 1992003440.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1984, Daniel Worobec, 18 years old, was last seen in Lanigan, SK. A witness stated that Mr. Worobec told him he was waiting for a ride. Searches and investigation have failed to locate Mr. Worobec

Boots: Brown, cowboy boots with square toes
Hat: Blue, White, ball cap with writing on it

Case reference: 2014005913.CaseDesc: Douglas Bender was last seen in the North End area of Winnipeg. He is known to frequent the downtown area. It is uncharacteristic for Mr. Bender not to be in contact with his family.

Jacket: Grey, Brown, Winter/parka with fur-trimmed hood

Case reference: 2016068415.CaseDesc:
On July 17, 1975 a "Hush Puppy" style loafer shoe, size 10, containing a skeletonized left foot was found on the south shore of the Ottawa River in Chute a Blondeau, Ontario. The colour of the shoe is not discernible. 
Examination of the foot bones by a Forensic Pathologist revealed that this individual may be a male, aged 20-50 years, 5'10" to 6'1" in height, 200-230 lbs., with no abnormalities of the foot bones and no arthritis. The Forensic Pathologist had estimated that death occurred in excess of one year to possibly 5 years.

Case reference: 2019061160.CaseDesc: The body of this young to middle-aged male was found in September 2019 near Merritt, British Columbia. He had brown hair, a muscular build and no obvious scars or tattoos. The RCMP are investigating this as a suspicious death.

Sweater: Cloth, Brown, “Brunella Gori” brand with hood

Case reference: 2017075870.CaseDesc: Andrew Jutte was last seen around September 20, 2017, in the downtown core of Vancouver, British-Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004024.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1989, Ernestine Kasyon was seen for the last time while leaving a residence to use a payphone in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2013000129.CaseDesc: Immaculate Basil was last seen June 14, 2013 on a road in a remote area north of Fort St James, BC.

Case reference: 2012020113.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2004, Sylvie Menard was reported missing in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. Sylvie was last seen at approximately 1:00 p.m. in a licensed establishment located at the intersection of 3rd Row and Highway 359 (Main Street) in Saint-Luc-de-Vincennes, Quebec.

Case reference: 2006000699.CaseDesc:
On January 31, 1988, a male was found on the Don Valley Parkway, having jumped from the Bloor Street Viaduct in Toronto. He is described as a dark-skinned Caucasian. His post-mortem length was recorded as being approximately 5’5"-5'6", however, this measurement may not represent his actual living length due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  
He has a thick beard and moustache. He also has a significant amount of body hair. His appendix is present.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Thick receding hairline, bushy eyebrows
Teeth: Full set of natural teeth: exception of third molars. Amalgam fillings in some post. teeth, U-left lateral incisor is peg-shaped
Jacket: Leather, Brown, "House of Peerless" Winnepeg, Canada brand, size large,
Shirt: Long-sleeve salmon-coloured shirt with vertical blue stripes
Shoes: Grey leather shoes with rubber crepe soles
Underwear: Green, White band, "Watsons" brand, size large
Mark: Left Cheek, Large nevus (mole) on the left side of his face beside his nose.

Case reference: 2016069136.CaseDesc:
This left lower arm and hand were recovered from the CPR rail yard in Windsor on March 25, 2014. The partial limb is from a young adult male who has brown skin. There are numerous tattoos present, most of which do not appear to have been professionally done. While the limbs appear to have been separated from the body after death, there is the possibility that the person remains alive. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be days to months.
Remains located in the CPR Freight Yard in Windsor on a lesser used track.  Biographic ancestry testing predicts person of Americas or mixed Americas and European Ancestry.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Unrecognizable designs of partial tattoos

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish.  They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2014005158.CaseDesc: Mr. Frederick Lagrelle was last seen on April 12, 1997 in the area of the Sunchild and O’Chiese First Nations in Alberta. It is possible Mr. Lagrelle was seen in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta days after. He was known to walk with a cane and wear a leg/knee brace. Mr. Lagrelle was described by family as having an intellectual disability as a result of a past accident.

Case reference: 2014006338.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1988, George Burke was last seen by his wife, when he left their residence in Edmonton, Alberta, to take the bus to work. That day, George did not arrive at work, and it is unknown whether he caught the bus.

Case reference: 2006016999.CaseDesc: Donald Hemsworth was last seen in the area surrounding Twitchgrass and Hilda Lakes, Farr Township on October 8, 1974.

Case reference: 2014002566.CaseDesc: On May 1985, Sheryl Lyn Donahue was seen for last time in Victoria, British Columbia. There were some indications she may have travelled to Vancouver, Alberta or Toronto.

Case reference: 2014006252.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2013, Meagan Rose Pilon was seen for the last time at her family home in Sudbury, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Meagan was living in the New Sudbury area. Police have not been able to rule out foul play in her disappearance.

Mark: Left Chest, Red birthmark on inner left breast

Case reference: 2012020011.CaseDesc: Daniel Richard McCallum was living in the Lillooet, BC area up until October 2008.  When his family hadn't heard from him for some time, they reported him missing. There are unconfirmed reports that he may have moved away, but police have been unable to determine his whereabouts. His disappearance is considered suspicious.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, scorpio sign with "Dan" written inside

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004759.CaseDesc: On the 21st day of March, 2006, Tayven BEAR was playing with two other children on the ice of the Churchill River in Sandy Bay. Tayven fell into the river and his body was never recovered.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing 4 front upper teeth
Jacket: Nylon, Blue, Waist length ski jacket

Case reference: 2012020645.CaseDesc: Peter Mckay was playing on the ice along the South Saskatchewan River in the Riversdale area of Saskatoon, SK in the late afternoon hours of December 31, 1986. Peter subsequently fell into an open portion of the river and was never found.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Orange, with a yellow stripe on the cuff

Case reference: 2014005024.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2007, Pierre Landry was seen for the last time in the area of Saint-Joseph-de-Beauce, Quebec. Pierre would have left his residence on foot and there are no indications in the direction he would have taken.

Case reference: 2014042438.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2014, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Delaram Hashemi was seen for the last time leaving her home in Toronto, Ontario. Delaram had told her mother that she would be attending a party and would return home at 10:00 p.m., but she never returned.

Case reference: 2015027786.CaseDesc: On May, 28, 2015, Jessica Heppner was reported missing by a friend and travelling companion. Jessica was visiting St. John's Newfoundland and was staying at the Sheraton Hotel. She was known to utilize Taxi Cabs as a mode of transportation. She never returned to the hotel to get her belongings.

Case reference: 2005007099.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1982, an unidentified man was recovered from the Maid of the Mist pool in the Niagara River. His age was estimated to be between 25-50 years old. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 192-195 lbs and his length was measured at 5'9"-5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: His teeth contain both amalgam and composite resin fillings.
Scar: Right Side Of Head, He had previous brain surgery (craniotomy) on the right side of his head.

Case reference: 2014003304.CaseDesc: Milde was last seen in 1993 where his vehicle was abandoned near the City of Lethbridge Landfill. Footprints in the snow were seen leading from the vehicle into the coulees and disappeared.

Case reference: 2014004058.CaseDesc: On January 11, 2001, Yvan Martellino was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Yvan was baptized in the name of Joseph Pierre Raymond Lussier. He studied communication and accounting. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019050899.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1975, the remains of an elderly man of a small stature were found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. He is believed to have died of a drug overdose approximately a week before he was found.

Case reference: 2015060160.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1970, a male was found floating in the water at the foot of Seguins Boat House in Rockcliffe, Ottawa. He has partially balding, grey hair. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158 lbs and his length was measured at 5'8", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Several anterior and posterior teeth were missing in the upper and lower jaw. He had 1 cent and a pack of matches in his pocket. It is believed that he had been in the water for up to 48 hours prior to recovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Several anterior and posterior teeth were missing in the upper and lower jaw.
Watch: Gold, Gold band with expansion; with the inscribed initials "C.I.B."
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 1.5 x 1 cm slightly depressed scar on his left temple

Case reference: 2014004419.CaseDesc: Holly Painter was initially reported as a missing person on June 26, 1995. On that evening, two friends of Holly's reported that they were at her residence when an argument broke out between Holly and one of the friends. They said that Holly assaulted that friend; the other friend then took Holly from the residence. All 3 of them left in the second friend's vehicle, with him driving. He reported that he intended to take Holly to her parents' residence, however, while making a left turn at an intersection, she jumped out of the vehicle and ran off.

Case reference: 2021013057.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2020, an abandoned vehicle belonging to Jerry Zawacki was located in the parking lot of 332 Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. New York State Police investigators obtained surveillance video which captured Jerry looking over a railing, near the brink of the Falls, and walking towards the direction of the pedestrian bridge.

Case reference: 2009000199.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1996, Alf Joergensen left his residence to go on a business trip to London, England. Mr. Joergensen told his wife he would be returning on either October 22nd or 23rd. He indicated he was meeting a business associate in London, however it was later confirmed there were no scheduled  business meetings with this particular individual, who hadn't seen Mr. Joergensen since the previous year. Mr. Joergensen flew to England on October 17, 1996 and was confirmed to have flown into Toronto airport on October 19, 1996, via British Airways. He has not been seen nor heard from since this date and his family and police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Rear teeth both sides of upper jaw missing.  Dental records available.

Case reference: 2005001899.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1978, the body of this adult male was found floating in the St. Lawrence River, near Prescott. He is described as being possibly Caucasian. His weight at autopsy was 171 lbs. and his appendix was present. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of East Asian ancestry (note that this includes the Philippines).

Case reference: 1984142670.CaseDesc: On January 20, 1983, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Tania Murrell was seen for the last time as she left school to return home.

Case reference: 2016010572.CaseDesc: Richard Jones was last seen at his family’s residence in Brantford in late fall of 1975 and has not been seen since. Mr. Jones was also enrolled in the Graphic Design course at Sheridan College’s Oakville Campus in September of 1975.

Case reference: 2014003001.CaseDesc: Mr. Westbrook was last seen during the late afternoon/early evening hours on September 8, 1994. Mr. Westbrook had stopped at the Highwayman Restaurant located at 3001 Highway 11 North to gas up a motor home as he was attempting to return to Strathroy, Ontario. Family members had followed him in their vehicle and took away his keys to prevent him from driving any further as they were concerned about his driving. After a confrontation with his family members he was last seen walking southbound on Highway 11 in an agitated state. He was observed walking and hitchhiking heading towards the city of North Bay, ON. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2018063267.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2001, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Silvia Stewart was seen for the last time at the Caribana Parade in Toronto, Ontario. Silvia had been visiting Toronto with her daughter from South Carolina, USA, and she suffers from Alzheimer’s.

Case reference: 2014004367.CaseDesc: Kendall Sumner has gone away in the past without notifying anyone, however for him to be away this long is completely out of character.

Case reference: 2020008361.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1991, at approximately 4:00pm, Ian Dickson was last seen leaving a restaurant near Yonge Street and Eglington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Ian was visiting from Scotland, and was due to return on May 23, but he did not board his flight.

Case reference: 2014002904.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1980, Marcel Lapointe was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004137.CaseDesc: On the night of October 5, 1976, Jean-Luc Ringuette was seen for the last time when he left his home in Sainte-Anne-de-Madawaska, New Brunswick. The following morning, Jean-Luc did not attend school. A few weeks prior to his disappearance, he had disclosed that he had some money, and that he and a friend were going to leave town.

Case reference: 2014001414.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1967, Sarah Ovayuak was last seen as she fell into the Tuktoyaktuk Harbour while trying to board a Coast Guard vessel.

Case reference: 2005006799.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1978, an unidentified woman was discovered in an area of bush on the Chudleigh’s Farm in Milton, Ontario.

Teeth: Other, Had been edentulous for many years prior to her death.

Case reference: 2014004412.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1998, Mohammad Oloumi was last seen in Brampton.  It is believed that Mohammad may have travelled to an unknown destination in Asia.

Case reference: 2014001095.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 11, 1998, the body of an adult female believed to be between the ages of 30-40, with long dark hair and blue eyes was found deceased at the Broadway SkyTrain Station in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was very lean and pale and was wearing a long red wool coat over jeans and black ankle boots.

Coat: Wool, Red, Long coat with hood

Case reference: 2021053826.CaseDesc: On November 14, 2021, Lawrence Miller was seen for the last time in Holtyre, Ontario. Lawrence’s cats and dog were left unattended at this residence, which was out of character for him, and his all terrain vehicle was subsequently located in a nearby trail.

Case reference: 2006019899.CaseDesc: Frank Uncapher was last seen on Lac Seul on October 21, 1974. He was on a hunting trip.

Case reference: 2006012399.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, an unidentified man was discovered in the Ottawa River, near the Ottawa Rowing Club, in Ottawa, Ontario.

Shirt: Blue, Black, Long sleeve, Plaid; flannel; size extra large

Case reference: 2014003432.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1979, June Johnson was driven by a friend to the Marlboro Hotel in Prince Albert.  June has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020109.CaseDesc: David Fortin was last seen while waiting for the school bus on the morning of February 10, 2009, in Alma, Quebec. He was to take the school bus at approximately 7:50 am to get to the Camille Lavoie High School in Alma. However, he never got onto the bus and did not report to school. According to his family, David was a victim of bullying and intimidation at school for several years.

Case reference: 2014006231.CaseDesc: Luis Rodrigues was visiting Canada on a student visa. He was despondent over failing his classes and his visa being expired.

Case reference: 2014004734.CaseDesc: Roland Langlois went missing from the Malartic hospital on August 13, 1978. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006019099.CaseDesc: Janet Derbyshire was last seen on December 4, 1976, in St. Joseph Island near Sault Ste. Marie, ON.  She was  seen jumping off the St. Joseph's Island Bridge into the  water. She was seen floating downstream for approximately .25 miles before she submerged under water. Janet Derbyshire is presumed drowned but her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014002802.CaseDesc: Gérard Sabourin was last seen around noon on August 7, 1975 when he left his furniture factory business on Saint-Nicolas Street in Laval, Quebec. His vehicle was found on Champlain Blvd. in Montreal, Quebec on August 19, 1975. Gérard has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: False, No teeth, wears upper and lower dental prostheses
Shirt: Black, Orange, Black with orange flowers

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2014005760.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1992, Gaétan Rodier was last seen on his snow machine ice fishing on Lake Temiskaming in the District of Temiskaming, Ontario.  Subsequently, Gaetan’s snow machine had gone through the ice, and was recovered by divers, however, Gaétan was never located.

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2014005453.CaseDesc: On December 9, 2004, Sheila Adamo was seen for the last time when she left the family residence in Ottawa, Ontario. She is known to travel to the East Coast as well as into the United States.

Case reference: 2014004992.CaseDesc: On October 12, 2004, at approximately 11:30 a.m., Kim Evans was seen for the last time at the North York Women’s Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Kim had said she was going to her family’s residence to collect her personal belongings.

Pierce: Nose, Nose ring on the right side

Case reference: 2008006298.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1996, Audrey Desjardins dropped her friend/co-worker at her residence in Welland after working a night shift.  Mrs. Desjardins was driving a red four-door 1985 Ford Crown Victoria.  The car was in excellent condition and there was a Canadian flag bumper sticker on the left rear bumper.

Boots: Black, running shoe styled work footwear
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Brown, 2 brown stripes on front going to shoulders, belte

Case reference: 2015026912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2015, Kandice Singbeil was seen for the last time by her boyfriend in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2006013399.CaseDesc: Dustin Rhodes has been missing from the area of Timmins, Ontario since July 6, 1991.  He was last seen around 11:00 a.m. on that day near his cottage on Gibson Lake.  His truck was found at that location but Mr. Rhodes has not been seen since.

Pants: Cotton, Grey, Blue, Grey or blue work pants

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2006010399.CaseDesc: William Halverson was last seen getting into a canoe at Bald Indian Bay in Lake of the Woods. He failed to arrive at his destination of Pine Portage Bay.

Case reference: 2014001218.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1974, the body of an adult female was found approximately 19 miles Northeast of Penticton near Chute Lake Road, Naramata. The body was located down an embankment beside an isolated narrow dirt road in a heavily wooded area. It is estimated that the body had been at this location for a couple of months. It was noted that the female’s teeth were in good condition and she had high quality fillings that were done within two or three years prior to death. Minor orthodontist work was done when the female was a young girl.

Teeth: Good, High quality fillings; good hygiene

Case reference: 2014004844.CaseDesc: On September 30, 2006, Aaron Derbyshire, was seen for the last time in the early morning hours in downtown Kelowna, British Columbia.  Aaron, a long term resident of Kelowna, had spent the evening out with friends after a day's work as a local surveyor.

Case reference: 2014001642.CaseDesc: In October of 1983, Edna Smith, 24 years old, was last seen at a camp with two other persons on East Trout Lake located approximately 120 kilometers north of Prince Albert, SK. A search party located the bodies of the two companions, however, she has never been located. A boat the trio had previously used was found capsized in the lake and it was suspected that all three individuals drowned.

Deformity: Mouth, cleft Palate had been operated on

Case reference: 2014005473.CaseDesc: Shayne Murray Robinson was last seen in Celista, British Columbia on July 23, 2010. On July 24, 2010 the vehicle that he drove was found abandoned near Barriere on Hwy 5, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001384.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1974, Gilles Larose was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001591.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1997, Gordon Mertz was seen for the last time at the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) on East White Hills road in St. John's, Newfoundland. Gordon worked as a Fisheries Scientist, and records show that he logged off of his computer and left the building shortly after 5:15 p.m.

Case reference: 2014005495.CaseDesc: David Harrison Powell went missing on September 22, 2010. Mr. Powell was last seen leaving his residence. His vehicle and other important property were left behind.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Ankle, Unhealed break, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014003167.CaseDesc: Rufus Standingribbon was last seen in the month of October 1999 near Spirit River, Alberta. Mrs. Standingribbon did not notify anyone that he was going to be leaving the area as he normally did.

Case reference: 2011001699.CaseDesc: Justin Rutter left home on October 8, 2009 and failed to return.  He is known to frequent Lower Town in Ottawa, Ontario however, has not been seen in that area since that day. Justin may have met with foul play.

Coat: Beige, with white pattern on it
Mark: Right Cheek, 3 moles/freckles in the shape of a triangle

Case reference: 2012020152.CaseDesc: This adult male washed ashore at end of trail # 3 at UBC in Vancouver.

Hair: Brown, Short, Crown of dark hair and a goatee
Teeth: Good, Superior dental health, total absence of dental work, pronounced overbite and crowded lower teeth

Case reference: 2014005549.CaseDesc: At the end of September, 2010, Dustin McMillan left Edmonton to drive to Ontario. Police have not been able to confirm where and when Dustin was last seen but he never made it to his final destination.

Case reference: 2014003086.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1997, Maurizio Di Caprio was last seen in Montreal. He left for Chicoutimi or Toronto to bring a vehicle back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2009000299.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1989 at approximately 5:30 pm, Mr. George Giles and a friend left Mr. Giles' cottage on Fox Island in Lake Simcoe enroute to a marina at Island Grove.  Weather conditions were very poor at the time and the boat eventually capsized some distance from shore, after taking on water. His friend managed to swim back to Fox Island but Mr. Giles was not able to make it to shore, due to the treacherous weather and water conditions. On November 20th, 1989 the boat was discovered stranded on a sandbank near Joyland Beach in Orillia. Mr. Giles' body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2006004399.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1970, Eldie Martin Sylvester attended the docks at Cedar Point, Georgian Bay, Ontario to await the "scoot" to Christian Island.  Witnesses believe that he may have left on foot to walk home to Christian Island across the ice. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006000599.CaseDesc:
On May 12, 1988, this Caucasian male was a passenger on a motorcycle involved in a motor vehicle accident. His post-mortem height was recorded as being, approximately 5’7"-5’8" however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. 
He is described as well-nourished. He has rough, calloused hands with oil or grease under his fingernails.

Hair: Brown, Collar length hair, thin moustache
Teeth: Severe crowding of lower incisors and an amalgam restoration in each first molars with the exception of the upper left
Boots: Brown, Western boots, tan coloured leather with worn heels, "Modella" Brand, size 9 1/2-D
Socks: White sport socks with blue and green stripes
Chain: Gold, Chain, gold triangular loop charm with a "Playboy Bunny" in the center.
Underwear: Black bikini style underwear, size L
Shirt: Black t-shirt with a "Jack Daniels" logo, size XL
Jeans: Denim, Blue, "Great Western Garment Company" brand jeans, size 36" waist and 30" inseam
Mark: Dark mole on the side of his left knee.
Scar: Scar in his right groin area, possibly from a hernia repair.

Case reference: 2014005078.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1992, Gloria Abotossaway was last seen by a family member on Shuter Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015069712.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Blake McCool was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004684.CaseDesc: Mr. Claude Gagné disappeared from the sector of Lac des Passes in a forested area near the municipality of La Tuque between September 1st and 2nd, 2000. His boat was found on the shore of the lake with the electric motor at the running position, and his car was found parked at the camp at the same lake. He went to the camp by himself and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2019066843.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2019, Feng Qin Zhou, was reported missing from her residence on Firbridge Way in Richmond, British Columbia. She suffers from dementia and has previously wandered away from her residence. Feng Qin does not speak any English and speaks only in Mandarin.

Watch: Red, Two watches, one on each wrist
Shoes: Pink, Slippers with heel support and hard soles
Coat: Black, Long coat down to the knees with hood
Shirt: Pink, Long sleeve shirt with white writing

Case reference: 2012020049.CaseDesc: William Krowchuk was last seen leaving his residence in Saskatoon, SK, around 10:00 p.m. on July 9, 1998. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was located on July 14, 1998, in the downtown area of Saskatoon.

Deformity: Left Large Toe, No toe nail
Right Large Toe, No toe nail

Case reference: 2014001617.CaseDesc: On January 25, 1976, Camille Lessard was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. He regularly went to the tavern located on the corner of Papineau  and Sainte-Catherine East in the Le Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Camille suffers from memory loss.

Case reference: 2019043636.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1994, the skeletal remains of a man were found in a well on agricultural land on rang du Côteau in St-Charles-sur-Richelieu, Quebec.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, 10K gold, wedding band, inscription "TNR ORA"
Belt: Leather, Black, With buckle, length 32 inches
Shirt: Cotton and polyester shirt with long sleeves, size 16-33

Case reference: 2013000062.CaseDesc: Leonard Pinnock has been missing since March 27, 2011. He is originally from Jamaica. He came to visit his family in Montreal and he never made it to the meeting place. He was last seen in the area of Notre-Dame-de Grâce in Montreal, Quebec. He travels between Toronto, Ontario, Montreal and Jamaica.

Case reference: 2011005399.CaseDesc: Carol Shelleau was last seen on July 29 1988, by her children, as she was leaving her home in Sault Ste Marie, Ontario. Carol got on the back of her estranged husband's motorcycle and has not been seen since. Her estranged husband was found deceased in Vancouver in September 1988. The motorcycle involved was located in Sault Ste. Marie. Foul play is suspected.

Backpack: Green, Duffle bag containing a bathing suit
Pants: White, With blue, pink and red stripes
Glasses: Large and round with tinted lenses

Case reference: 2014005742.CaseDesc: Philip Mark Oslizlok was reported missing by his family in early 2010. He was last seen on September 2, 2009 when he went to the Vancouver Police Department to receive an employment record clearance. Mr. Oslizlok last contacted his family via email on November 20, 2009 to inform them that he had gotten a job on a cruise line and would not be returning home for Christmas. There are no records of employment for Philip at any of the cruise lines. He has not been seen or heard from since.
